meanings.definition: To mock or ridicule someone or something publicly.
meanings.sent1: The comedian was pasquinading the politician during his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys pasquinading her friends in a playful manner.
meanings.sent3: The children were pasquinading each other's silly dance moves.
meanings.sent4: The internet meme pasquinaded the celebrity's fashion choices.
meanings.sent5: The cartoon character was pasquinading the serious news anchor in a hilarious skit.

meanings.definition: The act of satirizing or lampooning through written or spoken words.
meanings.sent1: The pasquinading in the play brought laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent2: His clever pasquinading in the article made readers chuckle.
meanings.sent3: The pasquinading in the comedy show was witty and entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The writer's pasquinading of societal norms was thought-provoking.
meanings.sent5: The pasquinading in the speech highlighted the absurdity of the situation.

meanings.definition: A form of criticism or mockery expressed through humor or sarcasm.
meanings.sent1: Her pasquinading of the movie plot was both funny and insightful.
meanings.sent2: The pasquinading in the cartoon strip made people smile.
meanings.sent3: The group's pasquinading of each other's fashion choices was all in good fun.
meanings.sent4: The comedian's pasquinading of current events was sharp and witty.
meanings.sent5: The pasquinading in the parody song was catchy and clever.
